node.title: Holder's double hat-trick helps West Indies to T20 series win over England
node.description: The Windies fast bowler took four wickets with the last four balls of the match.
node.content: ["Jason Holder has shattered England's hopes of Twenty20 success, with four wickets in the final four balls to lead the West Indies to a 17-run victory at Barbados and clinch a 3-2 series win.", "Holder bowled Saqib Mahmood to become only the fourth player to claim four wickets in four balls in T20 history, after already securing the scalps of Chris Jordan, Sam Billings and Adil Rashid in consecutive balls.", "\"Classic finish,\" Holder says. \"Not the best of starts, but we were just trying to stay in the game.", "\"People are seeing what I can do and giving me the responsibility. Every time I step on the field, it's about what I can deliver for the team.\"", "The West Indies set England a target of 180 to win, after hitting 179/4, with captain Kieron Pollard topscoring for the hosts, with 41 runs from 25 balls.", "After losing Jason Roy with eight runs on the board, England steadied themselves, as James Vince scored 55, before he was caught by Fabian Allen, off Akeal Hosein's bowling.", "Billings took up England's attempt to chase down the West Indies total, but with Jordan caught by Hayden Walsh, off Holder, the collapse began.", "Billings fell next ball to the same combination, while Rashid and Mahmood were soon on their way back to the pavilion, as the West Indies clinched the series decider in emphatic style.", "Reuters\u00a0"]
